data.title: 8 Of The Worst 'Saying The Movie Title In The Movie' Moments, And 8 That Give Me Chills
data.meta_description: "So that's it, huh? We're some kind of SUICIDE SQUAD?"
data.text:
"So that's it, huh? We're some kind of SUICIDE SQUAD?"

Am I the only person who gives a standing ovation when a movie character says the film's title?

Fox

No, just me? Maybe some examples would help. Here are eight "saying the movie title" moments that get me hyped, and eight that I think are duds:

HYPE: "The Dark Knight"

Warner Bros.

DUD: "Suicide Squad"

Warner Bros.

Advertisement

HYPE: "Brokeback Mountain"

Focus Features

DUD: "The Departed"

Warner Bros.

HYPE: "The Princess Bride"

20th Century Fox

Advertisement

DUD: "The Aviator"

Miramax Films

HYPE: "Back to the Future"

Universal Pictures

DUD: "Kill Bill: Vol. 2"

Miramax Films

Advertisement

HYPE: "Jurassic Park"

Universal Pictures

DUD: "Gone Baby Gone"

Miramax Films

HYPE: "The Breakfast Club"

Universal Pictures

Advertisement

DUD: "Gladiator"

DreamWorks Pictures

HYPE: "Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring"

New Line Cinema

DUD: "Face/Off"

Paramount Pictures

Advertisement

HYPE: "Full Metal Jacket"

Warner Bros. Pictures

DUD: "RoboCop 2"

Orion Pictures

There are thousands of examples of "movie title within the movie" moments, so please comment with your favorites below!
